Where would you like to process your loan application from? Select the location thatâ€™s most convenient for you, ensuring smooth coordination with the bank for residence and office verifications, and completing loan formalities without disrupting your schedule.

questions.question: If the registry has been done in the name of property owner(s)?
If the possession has been offered by the builder?
questions.description: "Possession offered" refers to the stage when the builder imps over the completed property to the buyer. It signifies that the buyer has made full payment to the builder and can now take possession of the property and start using it.

questions.question: Is there any outstanding demand from the builder that remains to be disbursed in the future?
Please confirm that selected property is situated in officially authorized area by the government?
questions.description: Most of the lenders prefer that your property location should be approved from respective "City's Development Authority" or "Municipal Corporation"

questions.question: If the construction of the property is as per "approved map" from the respective authority?
questions.description: Lenders can reject loan application if map is not approved by respective authority. Also construction of the property should be as per the approved map.

questions.question: If applicant or any of the co-applicants is NRI?
Please indicate the type of ownership for the property?
questions.description: Lenders need to ensure that the property meets legal requirements and compliances related to ownership rights, land tenure, and property transfer.

questions.question: Please specify the nature of property purchase?
questions.description: The loan process differ based on how you're buying the propertyâ€”especially when it comes to disbursing funds and providing the right documents. This mainly depends on whether you're buying directly from a builder or authority, or through are sale from an individual owner .

questions.question: What type of construction is it?
Please specify the construction stage of the property?
questions.description: The loan criteria, documentation, and disbursal process differ based on the property's stage. For under-construction properties, banks release funds to builders according to the Construction Linked Plan or Time Linked Plan (CLP/TLP). For Ready-to-Move properties, banks disburse the entire loan amount at once.

questions.question: Please specify if the selected property is registered in the name of seller(s)?
questions.description: If the property hasn't been registered, the transaction is termed as "Endorsement" or "Builder Transfer". Legal requirements and disbursement procedures differ from registered property cases. If the seller hasn't completed registration and the construction is Ready to Move-in, ensure to check for an Occupancy Certificate. Without it, only select lenders may approve your loan application.

questions.question: If any demand from the builder is due?
questions.description: There might be outstanding or upcoming demands according to the payment schedule. Seller must settle any outstanding demand to obtain a No Dues certificate from the builder before Transfer/Endorsement. The lender will disburse upcoming demands only after receiving the property papers at their end.

questions.question: What is the total amount outstanding according to the payment plan?
questions.description: This amount represents what needs to be paid later according to the builder's payment schedule. Amounts under â‚¹12,000 are not considered significant. In such cases, kindly select â€œNo builder demand.

questions.question: From where the property is being purchased ?
Enter the name of builder.
Enter the name of Authority.
Please specify if the property is on loan?
questions.description: You'll have to ensure if the seller has an existing loan on the property you're buying, as it can affect your loan options. You may need to use the seller's bank for the loan or have the seller transfer the balance to your bank, which could lead to complications in getting the best terms.

questions.question: Please select all the lenders, from where project is approved.
questions.description: If any of approved banks arenâ€™t listed here , we're really sorry â€” we currently donâ€™t have enough data to provide accurate loan or affordability details for those lenders. As a result, we're unable to proceed further with the calculation at this time.

questions.question: Select the lender from where seller's loan is running.
What is the foreclosure Amount?
questions.description: This Amount will be paid to the seller's Bank.

questions.question: If seller / any of the seller's is NRI?
From where the property is being purchased ?
What's company type?
questions.description: Select the type of company who is applying for the loan. Be informed, the property should be in the name of company and not in the name of owner or director.

questions.question: How would you like to assess your companyâ€™s loan eligibility?

switch.then: How many family members are applying for the loan? (including the primary applicant)
How many Directors/Partners are there in the company?
Please include all the members whether their name is on property or they are coming for the loan repayment. (for family)
As the property is being purchased in the name of the company, it will be the primary applicant and all the Directors/Partners will be co-applicants on the loan. (for company)

questions.question: What's the full name of the applicant ?
questions.description: How it appears on PAN, Passport, Aadhaar or Driving license.

questions.question: Please specify the reason for this person's involvement in the loan?

options.label: Loan repayment and having name on the papers
options.value: Loan repayment and having name on the papers

questions.question: Is the applicant NRI?
What's your employment status?
If the Provident Fund (PF) is being deducted from salary?(Optional)
questions.description: If PF is not deducted from your salary, your employer might not be registered with certain lenders. This could result in your loan being approved at a higher ROI. Donâ€™t worry; we'll inform you of this before submitting your loan application to your chosen lender.

questions.question: What is your current age? (select completed years only)
questions.description: It is required to assess your loan eligibility and tenure for the loan.

questions.question: Please select your profession.
questions.description: Banks will require you to provide relevant certificates or degrees during the loan application process.

questions.question: If Income Tax Returns are available for last three consecutive financial years?
What were the Gross Receipts in the last three financial years?
What were the Net Profits for the last three financial years?
What is the monthly gross income?
questions.description: Gross income is your total monthly earnings before deductions (tax, PF, NPS etc). A few banks use it to assess your loan eligibility.

questions.question: What is the monthly net income?
questions.description: Net income is your monthly earnings after deductions (tax, PF, NPS etc). It is the amount you receive in your bank account as salary.

questions.question: What's the additional monthly income from bonuses, incentives, and rental earnings?
questions.description: This includes the average monthly bonus received in the latest financial year (total bonus divided by 12) and the average monthly incentive received in the latest 6 months (total incentive divided by 6).You will need to submit a valid rent agreement and the rent amount should be reflected in your bank statement. Enter zero (0) if there is no additional income.

questions.question: Have you availed any unsecured Over Draft (OD) facility?
questions.description: When you opt for an unsecured OD facility, you are charged interest solely on the amount utilized. However, this is considered a financial obligation when applying for loans. The rationale behind this classification is that you have the flexibility to use the entire approved amount at any given time, potentially converting it into a personal loan.

questions.question: Select the lender from where you have availed the OD facility.
What is the tenure of OD (in Months)?
Enter your OD rate of Interest (ROI).
Enter your OD limit.
What are the monthly EMIs being paid from the account of {}
questions.description: Please enter total Amount of EMIs (Home Loan, Auto Loan, Personal Loan, Credit Card Loan etc). Do not include EMI's of the loans where remaining tenure is less than 12 months or you can close the loan before disbursement of the loan you are going to apply for. Enter zero (0) if there is no EMI.

questions.question: What is the combined limit of all the credit cards issued in the name of
What's the Credit Score?
questions.description: The credit score is a crucial factor that lenders consider to determine your creditworthiness. A higher credit score is essential for securing more favorable loan terms and interest rates, directly influencing loan eligibility and approval.

questions.question: Have you ever been defaulter

uiMeta.placeholder: Select the reason why you have low credit score

questions.question: What are the possible reasons behind your low CIBIL score?
questions.description: select all the applicable reasons to help us understand what may be impacting your credit score

options.label: Frequent use of full credit limit
options.value: Frequent use of full credit limit

options.label: Minimum due payments only on credit card
options.value: Minimum due payments only on credit card

questions.question: How long would you like your loan term to be?
questions.description: Term is the full length of your home loan - anywhere from 5 to 35 years. A longer term means you'll have lower monthly payments, but you'll pay more interest over time. Don't worry, you can change your mind later.

questions.question: Please provide the property allotment value?
questions.description: In case of unregistered property, a few government banks sanction the loan based on allotment value. This amount is mentioned in the allotment letter which seller would have received from the builder.

questions.question: What is the assessed market value of the property or the agreed-upon deal value with the seller?
questions.description: It's important to note that lenders conduct their own assessments of property value and determine it accordingly. This value may or may not align precisely with the agreed-upon deal value.

errorMessage.message: We are providing services for the minimum loan amount of 25 Lakhs. Hence the deal Value should be more than 25 Lakhs.

questions.question: How much amount you have for the downpayment ?
If there is any difference between the "Property Value" and the "Agreement to Sell value" for the purpose of "registry"?
questions.description: In many areas of India, it is common practice to declare a property's value lower than its actual worth in the 'Agreement to Sell' (ATS document) or 'Sale Deed' to reduce stamp duty costs. While this may be prevalent and tempting, we strongly advise our customers to ensure that all transactions comply with legal requirements to avoid potential risks and complications.

questions.question: Is your Agreement to Sell (ATS) ready ?
Would you like to know our suggestion for ATS value (Registry Value) or you will decide by yourself?

switch.then: Property Value as per 'Agreement to Sell' (i.e. ATS document)?
The optimum Property Value for the 'Agreement to Sell' document is shown below.
This will be considered as the registry amount on which stamp duty will be calculated.
Our AI recommends this value to secure the maximum possible loan amount while minimizing registry amount on which stamp duty will be calculated.
Down Payment (own contribution amount) as per 'Agreement to Sell' document?
The optimum Property Value for the 'Agreement to Sell' document is shown below.
Our AI recommends this value according to RBI's LTV ratio regulations and the suggested property value.

questions.question: What is the outstanding principal of the current home loan, as on today?
questions.description: The "outstanding principal" is the remaining amount of the original loan, which decreases with each EMI. Sometimes people confuse it with total of remaining EMIs, but that's not the outstanding principal amount. You can check this outstanding amount in "Schedule of repayment" or can ask from your lender.

questions.question: What's the current interest rate with existing Lender?
What's the remaining tenure to close the loan at existing Lender?(in Months)
Please select all the lenders, from where project is approved.
questions.description:
At times, a project may not be approved by all the lenders. Consequently, our results, which display offers from all lenders, may be ineffective. We recommend verifying with your sources and selecting only the appropriate lenders.
You can add multiple lenders one by one.

questions.question: Please select the lender with whom your current Home Loan is active?
What's the EMI of currently running Home Loan?
questions.description: Based on your inputs (outstanding amount, interest rate, remaining tenure), EMI should be around {}

questions.question: Have you taken any home loan insurance?
questions.description: When you take a Home Loan, the bank usually asks you to buy insurance, like Life and Property Insurance. They pay for it and add the cost to your home loan payments. But if you transfer your loan to another bank, these insurance policies get terminated. The remaining amount of 'insurance loan' doesn't get transferred with your home loan. So, before Balance Transfer, a few lenders may ask you to pay off this insurance loan yourself. Please be informed that the newly opted bank may also demand the insurance for the full loan amount.

questions.question: What's the outstanding insurance amount?
What would you estimate the current value of your property?
questions.description: If uncertain, please provide your best estimate. Keep in mind that lenders will independently evaluate the market value of your property and determine the maximum lending amount accordingly.

questions.question: What loan term would you prefer with the new lender?
questions.description: You can choose a term between 5 and bank-wise maximum years. A longer term will result in lower monthly payments but higher total interest over time. You can always change your decision later if needed.
